prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: PKS1138 Band-7 observation with C36-5 (0.14 arcsec)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: A project to obtain a spatially resolved dusty star formation within massive star-forming galaxies with ULIRG-class luminosity in the PKS1138-262 proto-cluster at z=2.16. In this SG, we aim to observe with high-resolution mode (with Band-7 C36-5 configuration) to identify ~kpc clumps within each galaxy.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We aim to observe with the single continuum mode, and so the default setup is fine.

The requested angular resolution of 0.14" is comparable to the image quality of the HST/ACS (rest-UV) data available for the same target galaxies, and also comparable to the typical size of star-forming clumps as reported in many recent studies. Therefore we believe that this angular resolution is the best choice for identifying dense/compact ~kpc-scale clumps. We note that we may miss a fraction of their flux from diffuse component with the high-resolution configuration alone. In order to quantify the contribution of compact clumps to the total flux, we also request observation with poorer spatial resolution (with 1.0-arcsec) with another SG.

We will perform 12 pointings with Band-7 (345GHz) to detect dust continuum emission from ULIRG-class galaxies at z=2.2. We estimate the total IR luminosity of individual targets from MIPS 24um photometry, and their typical flux densities at Band-7 turned out to be ~1-mJy (which is computed by scaling the Lagache et al. 2004 template SEDs). We note that this is a "total" flux, and the goal of this proposal is to resolve the flux into several clumps. Assuming that the target galaxies have typically ~3 clumps (with equal luminosity), we need to detect ~1-mJy sources at ~15-sigma to detect ~5-sigma level for each clump. To achieve this goal, we request a RMS level of 0.060-mJy, which can be achieved with 10.6-min on-source integration based on the ALMA sensitivity calculator. The goal of this proposal is to identify the most luminous/dusty clump in each galaxy (rather than complete mapping down to diffuse components), and we expect this estimate would be reasonable.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: PKS1138 Band-7 observation with C36-1 (1.0 arcsec)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: A project to obtain a spatially resolved dusty star formation within massive star-forming galaxies with ULIRG-class luminosity in the PKS1138-262 proto-cluster at z=2.16. In this SG, we aim to observe with low-resolution mode (with Band-7 C36-1 configuration) to recover the total flux of each galaxy.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We aim to observe with the single continuum mode, and so the default setup is fine.

The requested angular resolution of 1.0" in this SG is set to recover the total flux (rather than spatially resolving the galaxies into kpc-scale clumps). This is important to avoid missing flux from diffuse components and to quantify how large fraction of dusty star-formation activity is dominated by compact/nucleated regions within the galaxies (see SJ).

We will perform 12 pointings with Band-7 (345GHz) to detect dust continuum emission from ULIRG-class galaxies at z=2.2. We estimate the total IR luminosity of individual targets from MIPS 24um photometry, and their typical flux densities at Band-7 turned out to be ~1-mJy (which is computed by scaling the Lagache et al. 2004 template SEDs). To measure their total fluxes with reasonable S/N level (>7-sigma), we request a RMS level of 0.14-mJy, which can be achieved with only 1.88-min on-source integration based on the ALMA sensitivity calculator. We note that we do not aim to spatially resolve dust emission from individual galaxies in this SG, but this is important to quantify the contribution from compact/nucleated clumps in combination with the other SG in this proposal (which aims to spatially resolve individual galaxies with 0.14-arcsec angular resolution).

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose ALMA Band-7 (870um) observations of H-alpha-selected, massive star-forming galaxies (with ULIRG-class IR luminosity) selected in a rich proto-cluster environment at z=2.16 (PKS1138-262). By spatially resolving their dust continuum emission on ~1-kpc scale, we will identify dust-enshrouded star-forming clumps inside the galaxies, and pinpoint the location of most intense dusty starbursts (hence rapid stellar build-up) within the young cluster galaxies. By comparing the nature/luminosities of SF clumps within proto-cluster galaxies with those of general field galaxies at the same redshift (which will be obtained through our successful ALMA Cycle-1+2 programme), we will determine if the SF clumps within the cluster galaxies tend to have boosted activity (due to their accelerated bulge growth), or if the massive star-forming galaxies reported in the proto-cluster environment are simple ``scaled-up versions'' of general field galaxies.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:relatedProposals: 2015.1.00395.S (PI: Kodama): CO(J=3-2) observation of the same target field - providing a complementary information. 2015.1.00432.S (PI: Dannerbauer), 2015.1.00851.S (PI: Emonts): Targeting the same proto-cluster field with different motivation. A few sources are overlapped - the teams agree to collaborate to optimise the scientific outputs.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
